Question: What is a key characteristic of the Agile methodology?
A: Complete system design before development
B: Short development cycles with continuous feedback
C: No customer involvement
D: Heavy documentation over working software

Question: What is a functional requirement?
A: A performance constraint
B: A security constraint
C: A function or behavior the system must perform
D: A maintenance guideline

Question: What is an advantage of layered architecture?
A: Fewer software components
B: Easier maintenance and scalability
C: Always better performance
D: Less need for testing

Question: Which phase usually takes the most time in the software life cycle?
A: Development
B: Testing
C: Design
D: Maintenance

Question: Which situation is LEAST suitable for using the Waterfall model?
A: Stable and well-defined requirements
B: Strong regulatory constraints
C: High uncertainty with frequent requirement changes
D: Projects with fixed scope and budget

Question: What is the main direct objective of conducting software reviews?
A: To improve team communication and collaboration
B: to detect defects early in software artifacts
C: To reduce development costs in later project phases
D: To train developers in organizational standards

Question: Which statement best describes a plan-driven development method?
A: Planning is done incrementally and requirements change frequently
B: development is based mainly on rapid prototyping
C: all development  phases are planned in advance and progress is measured against the plan
D: the system is built entirely from reusable components

Question: what is the main difference between vaildation testing and defect testing?
A: validation testing focuses in system performance while defect testing focuses on usability
B: validation testing checks whether the software meets user requirements  while defect testing aims to expose faults
C: validation testing is performed only after release while defect testing is done during development
D: validation testing is a static technique while defect testing is a dynamic technique

Question: Which statement correctly describes the relationship between system testing and release testing?
A: release testing replaces system testing and is performed only by developers
B: system testing and release testing have the same objectives and are performed by the same team
C: release testing is a form of system testing focused on validation and is usually conducted by an indepndent team
D: system testing focuses on validation while relase testing focuses only on defect detection

Question: An organization is maintaining a legacy system that has high business value but low system quality. According to software maintenance and evolution principles  which strategy is most appropriate in this situation?
A: scrap the system completely and redesign business processes
B: continue normal corrective maintenance without structural changes
C: Re-enginner the system to improve maintainability while preserving functionality
D: replace the system immediately with a new-off-the-shelf solution

Question: What is the main purpose of an operating system?
A: To design websites
B: To manage computer hardware and software
C: To edit videos
D: To store data on the internet

Question: What is the main benefit of the Observer design pattern?
A: It improves execution speed
B: It reduces memory usage
C: It allows objects to be notified automatically when another object changes state
D: It prevents runtime errors

Question: Which of the following best distinguishes product standards from process standards?
A: Product standards focus on management  process standards focus on coding
B: Product standards define software characteristics  process standards define how development is performed
C: Product standards apply only to testing  process standards apply only to design
D: There is no difference between them

Question: Which statement best describes ISO/IEC/IEEE 12207?
A: A prescriptive standard defining specific programming methods
B: A product-quality measurement standard
C: A framework defining software life cycle processes and activities
D: A certification standard for software engineers

Question: What is the main goal of Software Quality Assurance (SQA)?
A: To find bugs after the software is completed
B: To ensure software meets user needs only
C: To ensure that software processes and products comply with defined standards and procedures
D: To replace software testing activities

Question: What is a non-functional requirement?
A: A feature that calculates invoices
B: A function that stores user profiles
C: A constraint on the system’s quality (e.g. performance, security, usability)
D: A specific business rule for discounts

Question: In Scrum what is the main purpose of the Sprint Retrospective?
A: To present the product increment to stakeholders
B: To inspect the team’s process and plan improvements for the next sprint
C: To estimate user stories for the next release
D: To assign tasks to individual developers for the whole project

Question: Which type of software maintenance focuses on changing the system to work in a new environment (e.g., OS/hardware/platform)?
A: Corrective maintenance
B: Preventive maintenance
C: Adaptive maintenance
D: Perfective maintenance

Question: What is a key idea of the V-Model compared to the Waterfall model?
A: It eliminates documentation to increase speed
B: It merges design and coding into one phase
C: It explicitly links each development phase to a corresponding testing phase
D: It is used only for Agile projects

Question: In a typical layered architecture where is the business logic usually implemented?
A: Presentation/UI layer
B: Business/Application layer
C: Data access layer
D: Hardware/Device layer
